root.TEXT:
Record date: 2071-02-19
79 yo female
post RSH hospitalization for failure to thrive, nursing home stay for three months.
home for one week. ruled out for MI, ct scan negative, diagnosed with depression.
home finger sticks in the 191 per vna.
in today wiht niece from Maine. no complaints except for knee pain at times. she uses walker.
she feels in good spirits and denies depression.
Problems
Hypertension
Osteoarthritis
Dizziness
amputation : 3rd left toe
Depression : with psychotic features
Lumbar disc disease : s/p discectomy
Cholecystectomy : s/p open procedure
H/O Atrial fibrillation : vs. atrial tachycardia -- s/p cardioversion 2/68
Diabetes mellitus : type 2
Pulmonary embolism : bilateral; tx'd at Buzan County Clinic
Myocardial infarction : NQWMI with inferolateral/apical depressions 5/31/69 - 6/04/69 at Buzan County Clinic; no cath or f/u ETT done there as pt requested conservative management
pulmonary htn
Medications
Asa (CHILDRENS) (ACETYLSALICYLIC Acid (C... 81MG, 1 Tablet(s) PO QD
Tylenol (ACETAMINOPHEN) 500MG, 2 Tablet(s) PO TID PRN arthritis pain
Glucophage (METFORMIN) 500MG, 2 Tablet(s) PO BID : PLEASE MAIL TO PT
Nexium 40 Mg 40 MG PO QD : PLEASE MAIL TO PT
Colace (DOCUSATE Sodium) 100MG, 1 Tablet(s) PO TID PRN constip : please mail to pt
Hydrocortisone 1% -topical CREAM TOP BID
IBUPROFEN 600MG, 1 Tablet(s) PO Q8H PRN pain : to be taken with food
Lasix (FUROSEMIDE) 40MG, 1.5 Tablet(s) PO QD PRN AND prn
Zestril (LISINOPRIL) 10MG, 1 Tablet(s) PO QD : PLEASE MAIL TO PT
Celexa (CITALOPRAM) 40MG, 1.5 Tablet(s) PO QD
Mvi (MULTIVITAMINS) 1 CAPSULE PO QD
ATENOLOL 25MG, 1 Tablet(s) PO QD : PLEASE MAIL TO PT
Ritalin (METHYLPHENIDATE Hcl) 5MG, 1 Tablet(s) PO QD
Allergies
* Haldol - Unknown
bp:120/70
pulse76
appears well
obese adult
cor:RRRs1s2
lungs: clear
abd: soft and nontender
ext: no edema
knees: thickened joints but no erythema or effusion
a/p:
diabetes: currently on 12 units of NPH. previously on glucophage only. will d/c insulin. have vna see her twice a week as before for finger sticks. restart glucophage at two per day for a few days and if tolerating resume previous dose of 2 tabs po bid. check hga1c.
f/u wiht me next month in dr. Carrie's absence
depression: appears to be doing well. cont with celexa and ritalin
pulm htn: cont with lasix.
cad: stable with no angina or failure.
f/u one month with me until dr. carrie's return
_____________________________________________
Trevor H. Vaughan, M.D.
